intro: Hieracium glaucophyllomorphum, commonly known as the glaucophyll blue hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue-green foliage and yellow-orange composite flowers. Native to certain regions of Europe, it thrives in grassy habitats and open woodlands. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
